title: Rudi Wulf
text:
Rudi Wulf (born 2 February 1984) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays for <a href="Lyon%20OU">Lyon</a> in the French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>. He previously played for <a href="Toulon%20Rugby">Toulon</a> and <a href="Castres%20Olympique">Castres Olympique</a>.
Wulf has also played for <a href="North%20Harbour%20Rugby%20Union">North Harbour</a> in the <a href="Air%20New%20Zealand%20Cup">Air New Zealand Cup</a> and the Auckland-based <a href="Blues%20%28Super%20rugby%20franchise%29">Blues</a> in the <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super 14</a> competition. He played for Marist in the North Harbour premier competition.
Wulf is regarded as a three quarter, in that he can play <a href="Wing%20%28rugby%20union%29">wing</a>, <a href="Fullback%20%28rugby%20union%29">fullback</a> and <a href="Centre%20%28rugby%20union%29">outside centre</a>.
He attended high school at <a href="Rosmini%20College">Rosmini College</a> where he played 1st XV rugby alongside fellow former <a href="All%20Black">All Black</a>, <a href="Anthony%20Boric">Anthony Boric</a>.
Wulf's career almost ended before it began when, in June 2005, he suffered a serious injury by diving into the shallow end of a swimming pool and fracturing vertebrae in his neck. He made a full recovery.
He is related to French <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> international <a href="Vincent%20Wulf">Vincent Wulf</a>.
